DOC.detailed_description: Vitamin K group name naturally occur phylloquinone ( K1 ) menaquinones ( MK-n ; K2 ) . The latter subdivide short-chain ( e.g . MK-4 ) long-chain ( e.g . MK-7 , MK-8 , MK-9 ) menaquinones . Earlier study show high vitamin K intake lead improved bone vascular health increase carboxylation vitamin K-dependent proteins tissue . In dietary range , MK-7 suggest effective cofactor carboxylation Gla-proteins , osteocalcin ( OC ) matrix-Gla protein ( MGP ) .Until , randomize control trial compare efficacy K1 versus MK-7 nutritional dose range . The investigator therefore interested compare effect K1 MK-7 OC MGP carboxylation supplement vitamin dose exceed RDA .
DOC.criteria: Healthy men woman , age 2080 year Normal body weight height ( 18.5 kg/m2 < BMI < 30 kg/m2 ) Stable body weight ( weight gain loss < 3 kg past 3 mo ) Written consent take part study Agreement adhere dietary restriction require protocol Abuse drug and/or alcohol Use vitamin supplement contain vitamin K Pregnancy ( history ) metabolic gastrointestinal disease , e.g . hepatic renal disorder , osteoporosis Chronic degenerative and/or inflammatory disease , e.g . diabetes mellitus , cancer , cardiovascular disease Use oral anticoagulant , drug hormone influence bone metabolism Corticoid treatment Subjects anaemia subject recently donate blood plasma Systemic treatment topical treatment likely interfere coagulation metabolism ( salicylate , antibiotic )
